thread.title: BREAKING: Kim Jong-un’s brother killed WEAPON OF MASS DESTRUCTION
thread.title_full: BREAKING: Kim Jong-un’s brother killed WEAPON OF MASS DESTRUCTION

title: BREAKING: Kim Jong-un’s brother killed WEAPON OF MASS DESTRUCTION
text:
Published 24th February 2017 
DS 
Kim Jong-nam – first son of former leader Kim Jong-il – was killed at Kuala Lumpur International Airport using a highly toxic chemical known as VX nerve agent. 
Two women – Doan Thi Huong, 28, from Vietnam and Siti Aisyah, 25, from Indonesia – wiped a liquid containing the poison on Kim’s face in the airport. 
Swabs taken from the eye and the face of the 46-year-old have revealed the poison was VX nerve agent. 
VX nerve agent – or S-2 Diisoprophylaminoethyl methylphosphonothiolate – is chemical weapon classified as a weapon of mass destruction by the UN. “Other exhibits are under analysis” Malaysian police chief Khalid Abu Bakar 
The US and South Korea claims North Korea assassinated Kim Jong-nam after he criticised his half-brother's regime. 
Malaysian police are holding one North Korean man – but are seeking another seven in connection with the murder. 
Malaysia asked Interpol to put an alert out to apprehend four North Korean suspects in the murder yesterday. 
VX is tasteless and odourless, and is outlawed under the Chemical Weapons Convention, except for "research, medical or pharmaceutical purposes". 
It can be manufactured as a liquid, cream or aerosol. 
Absorbed in large doses, it is fatal after 15 minutes – making it the most toxic known nerve agent in the world. 
MORE DETAILS TO FOLLOW
